member.name: F:ET.FW.Hal.E2E.E2EDataIDMode.Undefined
member.summary: Not set

member.name: F:ET.FW.Hal.E2E.E2EDataIDMode.Both
member.summary: Both bytes are used.
member.remarks: Two bytes are included in the CRC (double ID configuration) This is used in variant 1A.

member.name: F:ET.FW.Hal.E2E.E2EDataIDMode.Alt
member.summary: The two bytes are uses alternating
member.remarks: One of the two bytes byte is included, alternating high and low byte, depending on parity of the counter (alternating ID configuration). For even counter low byte is included; For odd counters the high byte is included. This is used in variant 1B.

member.name: F:ET.FW.Hal.E2E.E2EDataIDMode.Low
member.summary: Low byte is used
member.remarks: Only low byte is included, high byte is never used. This is applicable if the IDs in a particular system are 8 bits.

member.name: M:ET.FW.Hal.E2E.IE2EProtectionHandler.RegisterE2EProtection(System.UInt32,System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16[],System.UInt16,ET.FW.Hal.E2E.DataIdMode,ET.FW.Hal.E2E.E2EProfile,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Registers a E2E Protection for a CAN message
member.param: Bit offset of Counter in MSB first order. In variants 1A and 1B and 2, CounterOffset is 8. The offset shall be a multiple of 4.
Bit offset of CRC in MSB first order. In variants 1A and 1B and 2, CRCOffset is 0. The offset shall be a multiple of 8.
Bit offset of data in MSB first order.
Length of data, in bits. The value shall be a multiple of 8 and shall be 240.

For Profile 1x :A unique identifier, for protection against masquerading. There are some constraints on the selection of ID values, described in section 'Configuration constraints on Data IDs' Autosar SWS E2E Protection. For Profile 2 : An array of appropriately chosen Data IDs for protection against masquerading.

Bit offset of the low nibble of the high byte of Data ID. This parameter is used by E2ELibrary only if DataIDMode = E2E_P01_DATAID_NIBBLE (otherwise it is ignored by E2ELibrary). For DataIDMode different than E2E_P01_DATAID_NIBBLE, DataIDNibbleOffset shall be initialized to 0
Inclusion mode of ID in CRC computation (both bytes, alternating, or low byte only of ID included).
member.returns: true on success

member.summary: Registers a E2E Protection for a container CAN FD message
member.param: Bit offset of Counter in MSB first order. In variants 1A and 1B and 2, CounterOffset is 8. The offset shall be a multiple of 4.
Bit offset of CRC in MSB first order. In variants 1A and 1B and 2, CRCOffset is 0. The offset shall be a multiple of 8.
Bit offset of data in MSB first order.
Length of data, in bits. The value shall be a multiple of 8 and shall be 240.

For Profile 1x :A unique identifier, for protection against masquerading. There are some constraints on the selection of ID values, described in section 'Configuration constraints on Data IDs' Autosar SWS E2E Protection. For Profile 2 : An array of appropriately chosen Data IDs for protection against masquerading.

Bit offset of the low nibble of the high byte of Data ID. This parameter is used by E2ELibrary only if DataIDMode = E2E_P01_DATAID_NIBBLE (otherwise it is ignored by E2ELibrary). For DataIDMode different than E2E_P01_DATAID_NIBBLE, DataIDNibbleOffset shall be initialized to 0
Inclusion mode of ID in CRC computation (both bytes, alternating, or low byte only of ID included).
member.returns: true on success

member.name: T:ET.FW.Hal.E2E.DataIdMode
member.summary: The different mode available in AUTOSAR CRC calculation. There shall be following four inclusion modes for the two-byte Data ID into the calculation of the one-byte CRC:

member.name: F:ET.FW.Hal.E2E.DataIdMode.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown Mode

member.name: F:ET.FW.Hal.E2E.DataIdMode.E2E_P01_DATAID_BOTH
member.summary: both two bytes (double ID configuration) are included in the CRC, first low byte and then high byte (see variant 1A - SWS_E2E_00227)

member.name: F:ET.FW.Hal.E2E.DataIdMode.E2E_P01_DATAID_ALT
member.summary: depending on parity of the counter (alternating ID configuration) the high and the low byte is included (see variant 1B - SWS_E2E_00228). For even counter values the low byte is included and for odd counter values the high byte is included.

member.name: F:ET.FW.Hal.E2E.DataIdMode.E2E_P01_DATAID_LOW
member.summary: only the low byte is included and high byte is never used. This equals to the situation if the Data IDs (in a given application) are only 8 bits.

member.name: F:ET.FW.Hal.E2E.DataIdMode.E2E_P01_DATAID_NIBBLE
member.summary: The mode 3 - the high nibble of high byte of DataID is not used (it is 0x0), as the DataID is limited to 12 bits, - the low nibble of high byte of DataID is transmitted explicitly and covered by CRC calculation when computing the CRC over Data. - the low byte is not transmitted, but it is included in the CRC computation as start value (implicit transmission, like for dataIDMode equal to 0, 1 or 2) .

member.summary: Handler fotr offline protocol factories

member.name: F:ET.FW.Hal.Offline.OfflineProtocolFactories.factoryTypes
member.summary:
Dictionary, where all OfflineProtocolFactoryTypes are referenced to the PortTypes, for which they can create an Offline-Protocol.
Every Factory can support several PortTypes, but one PortType must not reference more than one Factory.

member.name: M:ET.FW.Hal.Offline.OfflineProtocolFactories.PrepareFactoryTypes
member.summary:
Creates a Dictionary containing all IOfflineProtocolFactory-Types found in corresponding Framework- and Usage-DLLs, indexed by a list of those portTypes supported by the corresponding IOfflineProtocolFactory. The supported types are fetched from OfflineProtocolPortTypeAttribute.
Only those IOfflineProtocolFactory-Types are added to the dictionary, which have at least one OfflineProtocolPortTypeAttribute.
The returned value is assigned to the member offlineProtocolFactoryTypes.
member.returns: Dictionary as described above

member.name: M:ET.FW.Hal.Offline.OfflineProtocolFactories.PrepareFactories
member.summary: Create dictionary for offline protocol factories.
member.returns: the dictionary
